TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageSourceTypeConverter extends System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter

Docs.summary: Provides type converters for converting <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"> objects to and from objects of other types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the base classes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter> for important usage notes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.ImageSourceTypeConverter"> class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the base classes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter> for important usage notes.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type sourceType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Type sourceType) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides contextual information.
The type of object to convert.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this converter can convert an instance of a specified type to a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource">.
Docs.returns: `true` if objects of the specified type can be converted; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, this method returns `true` only if is a <xref:System.Uri>.
The parameter is not used. See **Notes for Inheritors**.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type destinationType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides contextual information.
The type of object that you want to convert to a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource">.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.ImageSourceTypeConverter"> can convert a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> to an instance of a specified type.
Docs.returns: `true` if the conversion is possible; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, this method returns `true` only if is a <xref:System.Uri>.
The parameter is not used. See **Notes for Inheritors**.

Docs.summary: Converts a specified object to a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource">.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is not implemented in this classâ€”except to throw the exceptions. See **Notes for Inheritors**.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides contextual information.
The language and culture that are used during the conversion.
The object that you want to convert.
The type that you want converted to.
Docs.summary: Converts a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"> to an object of the specified type.
Docs.returns: The new <see cref="T:System.Object"> of the designated type. As implemented in this class, the object must be a <xref:System.Uri>. The object expresses the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the serialized image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, must be a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
As implemented in this class, must be a <xref:System.Uri> or the <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
The parameter is not used. See **Notes for Inheritors**.
